title.narrative: ICAR International Centre for Asset Recovery - Contribution 2011 - 2013

description.narrative: On ICAR: as part of the Basle Institute on Governance, ICAR is specialized on Stolen Assets / Stolen Asset Recovery. Its overarching mandate is to promote good governance in the public sector and in the business community, nationally and internationally. The Stolen Asset Recovery agenda is of political importance for Switzerland, given the fact that Switzerland has a long experience in taking legal measures against stolen assets deposited on Swiss Banks. The theme is equally important for several offices of the Federal Administration. The SIF (State Secretariat for International Finance), the DDIP (Directorate for International Law) and the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation are all involved, dealing with different aspects depending on their respective mandate. SDC's role lies in contributing to policy dialogue as well as capacity building, in specific cases also in monitoring of returned assets. In the last OECD Peer Review on Switzerland, the complementarity within the Federal Administration has been particularly highlighted (2009).

organisation.narrative: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation SDC
